Demonstrated proficiency in spoken and written German

The German Studies major begins from the point of the student’s German language course placement. No course below a student’s language course placement can be counted towards the German Studies major.
Students must complete German 301, 302, and 486 (Capstone Project).
German 301 or 302 must be taken before any other 300-level course is attempted but may be taken concurrently with other 300-level courses.
German 305 taken abroad may be substituted for either 301 or 302, but not both.
A: German Language, Literature, and Culture - Students may include one German Studies course taught in English or any relevant course with approval of major advisor.
B: Interdisciplinary German - Students may include two German Studies courses taught in English or any relevant course with approval of major advisor.

Majors are strongly encouraged to participate in the exchange program with the University of Tübingen, the University of Landau, or with a departmentally approved ISEP program during their junior years; equivalent courses from there will be accepted as substitutes.

The German Studies minor begins from the point of the student’s German language course placement. No course below a student’s language course placement can be counted towards the German Studies minor.
Students initially placing into 102 or higher must complete German 320 or 321.
German 301 or 302 must be taken before any other 300-level course is attempted but may be taken concurrently with other 300-level courses.
German 305 taken abroad may be substituted for either 301 or 302, but not both.
Students may include one German Studies course taught in English or any relevant course with approval of minor advisor.
Minors are strongly encouraged to participate in an approved summer German immersion or study abroad program. See minor adviser for details.
